title: New BMW 3 Series aces safety tests but Peugeot 208 and Jeep Cherokee slip
text:
The new BMW 3 Series range has been crowned among the leaders of the pack in the car safety stakes, having been awarded a top five star rating in the latest Euro NCAP safety ratings.

Meanwhile, although they scored highly both the new Peugeot 208 and the Jeep Cherokee were the only two cars tested this year that failed to achieve a full five star rating, both bagging four stars.

The French Peugeot 208 missed out on top marks because safety testers said its whiplash protection for passengers sitting in the back seats failed to cut the mustard.

Top marks for safety: BMW 3 Series frontal full width test in October 2019

The 97 per cent Adult Occupant Protection score awarded to the BMW 3 Series is one of the highest seen this year.

But, Matthew Avery, director of research at Thatcham Research, who delved a little deeper into the BMW 3 Series' ratings said that it didn't get top marks across the board.

In the safety technology category, the BMW 3 Series gained a score of 76 per cent.

'Whilst good, it’s 76 per cent score for safety technologies is down on the 94% benchmark set by the Tesla Model 3 earlier this year', Avery said.

He added: 'The BMW 1 Series also scored a top Euro NCAP rating, but again did not quite meet the standard set by the Mercedes A-Class in 2018.

'This goes to show how Euro NCAP ratings are driving an incredibly competitive safety market.'

Safety first: The BMW 3 Series scored top marks in Euro NCAP's latest safety tests

Four stars: The new Peugeot 208 scored four stars in Euro NCAP's latest safety tests

The BMW 1 Series achieved a five star Euro NCAP safety rating, scoring 87 per cent in the child occupant category and 83 per cent in the adult passenger ratings.

Euro NCAP said the Peugeot 208 'narrowly' missed a five-star rating.

The previous generation 208 model achieved top marks when it was tested in 2012, but Euro NCAP noted that its tests had been toughened since then, so the new machine still represents a step forward, and is fitted with more standard-fit safety technology.

Matthew Avery, director of research at Thatcham Research, said: 'The Peugeot 208’s four-star rating is respectable, but the car is not a good choice if you’re carrying adults in the back, with its "Poor" whiplash protection for rear passengers.

'Protecting both front and rear occupants is especially important as families continue to downsize from larger vehicles.'

High scoring: For the adult occupant rating, the BMW 3 Series scored 97%

Sticking points: The Peugeot 208 scored 56% in the vulnerable road user safety tests

Results: The Jeep Cherokee was awarded four stars in Euro NCAP's latest safety tests

The Peugeot 2018 also only scored 56 per cent in safety tests designed to work out how badly 'vulnerable road users', namely pedestrians, would be affected if hit by the vehicle.

On the Jeep Cherokee's scoring, Avery said: 'The Jeep Cherokee is an improvement on last year’s one-star Wrangler.

'However, there’s still a long way to go before Jeep can get back to producing five-star cars like the 2017 Compass.

'The Cherokee’s Adult Occupant Protection (80%) and Child Occupant (78%) scores are the lowest awarded in 2019, while the front and rear seats again offered marginal whiplash protection. It’s low-speed Autonomous Emergency Braking system didn’t meet the mark either.'

Whiplash tests now form a crucial part of Euro NCAP's safety tests, partly due to a hefty rise in whiplash injury claims a number of years ago.

In 2000 only 16 per cent of car seats were rated 'Good' for whiplash prevention, while by 2007 this figure had risen to 29 per cent. Today, the figure is closer to 100 per cent, according to Thatcham Research.

Avery said: 'Whiplash is now a key part of carmaker safety strategy, and seats today are specifically designed to protect occupants’ necks.

'Although the whiplash results seen in this round of testing don’t represent a significant backward step, the safety of rear seat occupants should remain a priority.'
